Laundry facilities are a plus. A Safeway Market is nearby. We came to visit the Black Canyon of the Gunnison, an easy drive from here. I would definitely stay here again next time I am in Montrose.

If you are traveling to Montrose, CO, chances are outdoor activities are in your plans. Greg's place is conveniently located to access roads and routes to national park locations, state parks, national forest sites, rivers and streams.

Inside, Greg's apartment is extremely comfortable for a party of two. The kitchen is well stocked and the dishwasher is easy to operate to handle daily use of dishes, cookware and utensils.

review_text:
This place was just perfect for my partner and I for a multi-day stay. We stayed here as a basecamp for the Ouray Ice Park.
The space was so comfortable and homey, impeccably clean and stylish.
The whole place is thoughtfully furnished for convenience and comfort. The kitchen especially was intuitively laid out with all the amenities we needed to cook - oven, stove, microwave, toaster, automatic coffee maker, tea kettle, good knives and cutting board, pans, dishes, mugs, wine glasses, etc.
The host is super attentive, made sure we had fresh creamer and coffee, and even came and salted the stairs after a snow/winter-mix storm blew through.
We are grateful for such a great find, and we look forward to returning!

Cat was a wonderful host and her place was perfect for our stay! Check in was seamless, the location was easy to find (minus the construction, no fault of hers) and she checked in to make sure we didn't need anything. We visit Montrose to see our son and grandkids and have used hotels and a couple of other Airbnb locations in the past. Going forward we hope to only use Cat's Airbnb when we come in to Montrose to stay as it was by far the best experience and the most comfortable stay; we could enjoy our time with our grandkids in the spacious living room and it was just really perfect!
Thank You Cat for such a wonderful stay!

review_text:
Cat and Mike were absolutely fantastic. We stayed in their AirBnb over the New Year while they were also there and barely heard/saw them. When we did encounter each other throughout the days, it was a pleasure chatting with them about the area and playing with their adorable pup ❤️
The house itself felt like a home away from home, and being musicians we were thrilled to find a piano and 12-string guitar waiting to be played! Another bonus is the massive flat screen and reclining couch to watch a movie while you eat; and if you want to cook, they have supplied EVERYTHING you need in a kitchen to cook an extravagant meal.
The decor is minimalistic yet charming, not too much not too little. Lots of play room for our own pup and a beautiful fenced backyard to hang out in (if its not 5°!). The home was spotless when we arrived 👍
I would highly recommend staying with Cat and Mike should you decide to visit Colorado, they are wonderful people and will accommodate you greatly! When my girlfriend and I decide to return to that amazing state, this will be the place we choose to stay! 🥰

review_text: We had a great stay at Michael's bungalow. The location was convenient to coffee shops and restaurants in Montrose and the neighborhood was quiet with easy street parking. The house is very comfortable and clean. It had everything we needed for our short stay. We did not have a need for the kitchen while we were there, but it had new appliances that would be ideal for anyone looking to cook. Michael was helpful and communicative throughout our stay. He sent ample information ahead of time to make sure we had everything we needed to check in easily and we arrived to some welcome snacks he'd provided. We had a late request for a later check out and he very kindly accommodated us. Montrose does not have a ton of affordable options for travelers and Michael's place is definitely a great option for anyone looking for something cozy and spacious!

So it was quite convenient for our week since we ended up visiting all three places. We wish the fridge could get colder though. Our drinks were just barely cold, despite sitting in the fridge for a few days. But it wasn't that big of a deal. We would definitely come back here again.

name: Mike
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
July 2022
,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text:
We had a very nice stay at this property which is pretty much exactly as described and pictured. The house is comfortable, well equipped, and is in a fairly good location. Street parking is plentiful, and the neighborhood seems nice enough. The house was VERY clean, and the kitchen had everything we needed to prepare meals each day. Michael's communication is excellent which made the entire process seamless.
There are a few items of note which may be worth consideration.
We could not find a hair dryer even though one is listed in the amenities. We did not mention it to the host while we were there because it was not a big deal for this stay, but you may want to consider travelling with your own just in case.
The shower is comically small. Think of something you might find in an RV. It did serve its purpose, and I guess is somewhat common in a 1920's home, but it could be an issue for larger adults.
Finally, a 9:00 am check out is pretty early. So, make sure that works with your plans. I imagine having extra time between guests helps Michael to maintain the cleanliness of his home which, in the end, is probably worth the sacrifice.
In all, this was a great experience, and I would not hesitate to recommend this property to my family or friends.
Thank you Michael!

Stayed with kids
review_text:
Michael's Bungalow was in the perfect location. In three days we:
- Visited Black Canyon National Park and did some great hikes
- Rented a pontoon boat on Blue Mesa Reservoir
- Viewed wildflowers and did some shopping in Crested Butte
- Played 18 holes of golf at Cobble Creek
- Walked to nearby restaurants in Montrose.
The house itself is pretty basic - as advertised, and the location was great. The size was perfect for three of us including my 11-yo. daughter. There was a nice selection of movies and games, and the back porch is pleasant for sitting and having a drink or playing cards. Check-in was easy with a smart lock, and Michael checked in with us a couple of times to make sure that we had everything we needed. Overall a good value and experience.

Stayed a few nights
review_text: We loved staying in Greg's place! It was spotlessly clean, well-stocked with everything we needed, and the bed was super comfortable. The listing said it was recently remodeled and we were impressed with the high quality finishes, upscale appliances and comfortable layout. Parking was spacious and we appreciated the motion-detector lights when we returned after dark. Greg was very friendly and responsive and had some great tips in his guidebook - we really liked the CO Boy Brewery and Camp Robber restaurants, San Juan Coffee House and Backstreet Bagel. The location was great - we were walking distance to downtown Montrose, a short drive from the South Rim entrance of Black Canyon National Park and only 45 minutes from the town of Ouray (we loved hiking the challenging but amazing Perimeter Trail there). We would definitely stay at Greg's place again and highly recommend it to other travelers!

The listing was very clean, the bed was comfortable, and the neighborhood was very quiet. Location was amazing - only 20 minutes to Black Canyon of the Gunnison, an hour from hikes near Mt Sneffels, and a bit further than that to Ouray and Telluride. I would highly recommend this place!

I would recommend Greg’s place for anyone traveling into Montrose!

review_text:
Greg's duplex was the perfect hub for our Southwestern Colorado adventure! The place is located in a cute, quiet, safe neighborhood and located within walking distance of town. The unit itself was beyond our expectations. It was cute, clean, had top tier amenities, easy parking, and a new shed for our bikes. This is a remodel of an older home but it was done well...very modern but still had original wood flooring! My wife is allergic to dogs so finding a rental that doesn't bother her allergies is tough. I know 'no pets' may be a deterrent for some but that is exactly why we would rent this place again.
This was a nice place to come back to as we explored Silverton, Telluride, Ouray, Gunnison Natl Park, Glenwood Springs, Grand Mesa Natl Park and much more! Perfect location!
Greg is a great host that made us feel at home: with clear instructions on anything we needed with the home, as well as recommendations for how to enjoy Montrose.

review_text: We had a fantastic stay at Greg's lovely, modern duplex in Montrose! It was very clean, spacious, well-designed and outfitted with high-quality fixtures and stylish lighting. Greg was an excellent host -- fast, warm, welcoming, helpful and detailed in all his communication. His attention to detail and thoughtfulness in supplying many items beyond the essentials made it one of the best-equipped Airbnbs we've stayed at. The kitchen was extremely well-stocked with a huge range of kitchenware including plenty of glasses, kitchen tools and baking tools not often found in Airbnbs, Pyrex dishes, oven trays, blender, cover for food in the microwave, cling wrap, foil, ziplock bags and a drawer of spices. The couch was very comfortable as were the stools and bed. It was really handy to have a washer/dryer in the bedroom plus parking at the rear. Last but not least, it was great the location was so close to Main Street and Riverbottom Park.

All in all a great, well located place.

There are thoughtful little touches like remotes for the light, fan and AC/heat which is nice when you don't want to get out of bed to turn them off.
I met the housecleaner and she was super nice and took pride in her work. The neighborhood is very cute and an easy walk to downtown. The storage shed in back looks like a very secure place to store bikes or other outdoor toys if you're traveling with them. I'd definitely stay here again!

review_text: This place is newer, beautiful and very clean. The porch light was out and she had it fixed that same day. The kitchen was stocked with plenty of pans and dishes. There were only two negative things I can say about it. One is it is downstairs and there is a space they rent upstairs. No one was there while I was there but someone came to clean. You can hear every footstep. I don't think there is carpet upstairs. There was a little one that was running around quite a bit. I heard every step of the person cleaning. I could hear them talking at one point. I was trying to work and the noise was very distracting. Also, I think the bed has a plastic type of mattress cover. Despite keeping the temperature very cool at night, the plastic caused me to sweat which made it difficult to sleep well. While I loved everything else about it, I wouldn't want to stay there if someone was renting the space above.

review_text:
2 weeks later we still remember our stay as a bad experience. We arrived almost at 9pm, it was already dark. There are several houses at this address but the sign does NOT list the proper one. It lists other houses & also some Twin Pines. The AirBnB description does NOT say Twin Pines anywhere (only the last pic does - but who ever remembers a picture after they booked their stay)! We drove in nonetheless hoping to see our house but it was nowhere seen. Instead several dogs were ran at us, barking. We turned around, went up the street hoping to find our house but it wasn't there. We returned to where GMaps led us & tried calling the host. No answer, the mailbox is full - unprofessional! We drove again in, this time someone came out & said this is the right place, pointed somewhere into black night, saying the host should've left the lights on (indeed).
We wouldn't complain in other circumstance, but: there was Keurig with 1 pod only, no tea bags, empty roll of toilet paper (come on!)

Overall, I would 100% stay here again. It's a lovely location and less than an hour from the San Juans.

Bathroom inside the house easily accessible, just a few steps from the airstream, and very clean. 10/10 would recommend.

Rating, 5 stars

,

Stayed one night
review_text:
We had an amazing time in Britanny & Matthew's Airstream !
The Airstream itself is great, well decorated with thoughtful little details that honour its heritage from the past. Everything worked perfectly and although we did not really use it since the weather was not too hot, the AC is a real plus. It is quite spacious for two, with many compartments for organising your personal belongings, a couch, a counter to prepare your meal and a table to dine inside if you want to. The backyard it is located on is also very beautiful with its string lights, a quite original teepee, and an outdoor table for those who enjoy dining under the stars.
We found the use of the shared bathroom very convenient since it is in reality quite private and very easy to access : you just have to cross the backyard and you use a private entrance. The bathroom is nice and clean, and once again very nicely-decorated.
Communication was really easy and we met with Matthew on our departure, who was very nice !

We loved this little Airstream! It was one of the most fun places we stayed during our two weeks in Colorado.
The airstream was well-decorated and charming. Even more than that, being in the airstream felt transportive. We listened to the records on the old-style record player and felt like we could glimpse another era.

name: Zhenya
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
July 2023
,
·
Stayed one night
review_text:
Our stay in the 1969 Airstream RV was like stepping into a vintage dreamland! From the moment we set foot inside, we were instantly transported back in time to an era of classic charm and adventure. It was an unforgettable experience that we will cherish forever.
The Airstream itself was a true gem. Lovingly restored and maintained, it showcased the perfect blend of nostalgia and modern comforts. The sleeping area was surprisingly comfortable, with the cozy bedding embracing us in a warm embrace each night.
Lastly, the hosts were outstanding. They were attentive, warm, and welcoming, making sure we had everything we needed for a fantastic stay.
I also want to highlight the outstanding hosting by Brittany, who truly went above and beyond to ensure our stay was exceptional. Throughout our stay, she was available to answer any questions we had and offered helpful tips for exploring the area.

Off street parking, outdoor chill area with fire ring and picnic table, along with their adorable cat (Fritz) pushed this listing over top. Clyde is a very welcoming stay with a very comfortable bed. Be sure to read the hand written note and check in instructions, this adds to understanding the layout, although simple enough, I did not and wished I had earlier. I hope this listing is available on our next visit to the Western Slope.

review_text: Kim and Gerald's cottage was great. It's located in a very quiet and peaceful area yet still very close to town. We used it as a base point for visiting the Black Canyon and a trip to Ouray. The cottage was very clean, the bed was very comfortable and had very nice linens. The bathroom was clean and had plenty of towels. The kitchen was very well stocked, so may extras that are very rare in other rentals. We had a dozen fresh eggs and some brownies waiting for us as well, delicious. My wife and I were very pleased with everything and would recommend a stay at this cottage.

name: Grant
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,

1 week ago
,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text:
Kim and Jerry were fabulous hosts and The Commons at Spring Creek Cottage was a fantastic spot to call our home while in SW Colorado!
Even before arriving, Kim and Jerry made us welcome with clear, friendly, and helpful communications. They went above and beyond answering questions I asked about the area.
The cottage was perfect: cozy living room space, well stocked kitchen (with homemade baked goods from the hosts), comfortable bedroom and bathroom, and an adorable patio with breathtaking views.
We loved that the cottage was situated on a quiet country road outside of Montrose, which is full of amenities. We did day trips to Telluride, Silverton/Durango, Black Canyon of the Gunnison National Park, and Ouray. This cottage truly is a fantastic location to do it all!
Check out was super easy and we even got to meet the hosts. They are so kind and welcoming. If we are ever back in the area, we will definitely stay with them again! Thanks for providing us a home away from home!

Stayed with a pet
review_text:
What a wonderful place with marvelous hosts, beautiful surroundings and just perfect in every way. I've stayed in many Airbnbs all over America and Europe and this is probably the nicest one ever. Montose is an excellent location to see so many great sights: Black Canyon of the Gunnison NP, Ridgway, Ouray, Telluride, Rico and many other lovely places. The street where you'll stay is like staying in the country with chickens, cows, horses and lots of interesting neighbors engaged in farming. It's like a step back in time.
I also want to mention that if you're travelling with your dog, the house is very dog friendly. Kim provides water/food bowls, doggy bedding and an ample backyard where your furry friend can sniff, explore and get some exercise. Dog walks are great on a bucolic road with little traffic. The kitchen is well stocked with anything you might need to cook or prepare your meals.
I give this Airbnb by highest recommendation, it's perfect in every way!

Rating, 5 stars

,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text:
The star of this AirBnB is the hosts - we arrived to fresh baked goods, fresh cut flowers, and farm-fresh eggs. The communication was great, and the cottage has all kinds of unexpected extras - spices, cooking oils, toiletries, teas and coffees, so many extras. The cottage also has amenities you won’t find at many AirBnBs, including fiber-based internet (the WiFi was 300 Mbps downlink/uplink, incredible and perfect for work!), a dishwasher and full-sized washer and dryer.
The decor of the cottage is just like the pictures, I would call it “grandma’s farmhouse” The back porch has a great view of the mountains, but the back of the Cottage has no windows in the common areas to see this view. There are small windows in the laundry room and back bedroom, but we were disappointed we couldn’t see the view from the kitchen or living room.
Overall a great experience, and we enjoyed our time in Montrose at the Cottage.

review_text: Kim and Jerry were wonderful hosts, among the best I've ever had anywhere. The house was exactly as advertised, and very comfortable. Kim's pre-arrival communications were great. The instructions were clear and easy to use, and there was a book of useful information about the house and a basket of local information brochures. But the best part of the stay was how warm and welcoming they were. They invited us to pick produce and herbs from their garden, and left eggs from their chickens in the frig and a freshly baked treat on the table. The plums from their tree were good enough to be worth a trip back on their own! It was so peaceful to stay there that if I lived closer than half a continent away I would be a regular guest.

But I also enjoyed that she left free eggs from their chickens, offered produce from their garden and baked a sweet treat.
This property is a few miles outside of town so may not work for those wanting to walk places but virtually all visitors need a car for this area and the quiet here makes for a great stay!

review_text: We were absolutely delighted when we walked in. Everything was pristine. Kim had left us homemade muffins, some of her yard eggs and other refrigerated items, too! The house had everything one could possibly need for a stay, lots of supplies, many spices, well equipped kitchen, and a whole cabinet full of breakfast food! Of note, the refrigerator is a mini refrigerator, but there is also a full-size refrigerator/freezer available in the shed next door so that was perfect for all of our drinking water and freezer items. The house even had two coffee makers in it! One was a Keurig, which I loved, and the other was a drip coffee maker. Plenty of coffees, too! We very much enjoyed sitting out on the patio in the mornings and evenings watching the birds, and looking at the gorgeous snow covered mountains in the distance. The setting is very peaceful. I highly recommend Kim’s place! You won’t be disappointed.

All this in a quiet, sweet little house just outside town, where you can see the mountains in the distance. I would absolutely recommend it.

Stayed a few nights
review_text: If you are looking to get away from the daily grind of everyday living, this is THE place to go. Situated on a dirt road out in the country, this place is an oasis of calm and beauty. The adorable 2-bedroom cottage sits on a spacious lot across from corn fields with spectacular views of the mountains. There is a small stream that runs along the back of the property whose sounds soothe the soul. Deer visited from the cornfield and the neighboring cat came for morning rubs. Sitting out on the patio was so relaxing after a busy day of exploring. The house was immaculately clean, the bed was super comfy, and the shower was hot. The location was close enough to Montrose but far enough away to make you feel like you were in a special place, all your own. I would definitely recommend the cottage a a premier place to enjoy the area!!!!

Everything was very clean, the bed was cozy and we loved the country setting. We had everything we needed and especially appreciated the washer and dryer! I loved the beautiful backyard patio and view of the San Juan mountains as well, I wish I had more time to spend out there during our stay. Thank you both so much and we hope to return!

It’s super quiet and serene. The front and back yard of the cottage are beautiful and I enjoyed sitting in the back drinking coffee in the morning and eating dinner in the evening and listening to the animals and running water. The cottage itself is great also. Two comfortable queen size beds, a good sized kitchen with all you would need, full sized bathroom, and a quaint living room with books and tv. Jerry and Kim were incredibly nice and communicated wonderfully. A couple weeks before our trip, they messaged us details about the ongoing road closures on the main highway into town and were very informative about getting to the cottage. Overall, I wish I could have stayed longer!!

The peaceful atmosphere was emphasized by the delightful hummingbirds around us or the visiting doe. The Commons is in easy travelling distance to Black Canyon NP or the hot springs near Ridgeway. review_text: What a wonderful place. I opened the door and began to feel the stress of travel and needs of life just bleed away. If you need rest and quiet this is the place. We were a party of three (married couple and daughter) and never felt crowded. Rather, for a smaller house it felt very spacious. It's clean, bright, comfortable and well-decorated. On the latter, some places we've stayed are almost choked with cute stuff - the decor here is tasteful and welcoming, not at all overpowering. Attention to detail??? Who puts earplugs in the bathroom on the chance that you find yourself with someone who snores? Someone who cares, who has the gift of hospitality. My only regret about staying here is not meeting Kim and Jerry - my bad, and another reason to return! Thanks for sharing your place.

I so appreciated Kim's kindness when she put me in touch with her friend from the Audubon Society after she learned that I'm a birder. The neighborhood is idyllic. I miss those gorgeous views, strolling down the road past the neighbor's horses and enjoying the sunsets over the mountains from the back patio. Kim is available without being intrusive. She's compiled lots of helpful information about the area. My husband and I had a great time there and would stay there again in a heartbeat!!!

The "electric hills" mountain biking trails were close by as well. Kim and Jerry were great hosts and the cottage was a great value. name: Tammy
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
May 2021
,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text:
THE STANDARD.
This. This is the standard that all other Airbnb’s should strive for.
Clean, well stocked, beautiful view, thoughtful hosts, convenient location, and welcoming!
The setting is out of a storybook. Cottage beside farm with spectacular Mountain View’s. The host greets us with fresh mixed greens (or vegetables in season ). On the dining table is homemade cookies, jam and protein bars ready to be packed for the days activities. In the fridge are fresh eggs and the coffee area is well stocked for morning. The back patio invites you to press pause and enjoy the beauty surrounding you. There is an extensive house Manuel including local information/tourism/medical or emergency info as well as an alphabetized list indicating where in the house the clothes iron or any number of amenities are located. Kim and Jerry are exceptional hosts and it was such a joy to stay here.

name: Martine
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars

Stayed a few nights
review_text:
Great little cottage in the countryside. Very close to the Black Canyon which was our reason for going to Montrose.
Kim and Jerry are great at communicating and answer questions very fast.
The kitchen is well equipped. Very quiet neighborhood.
We really enjoyed our stay there and would highly recommend it if you want to visit the Canyon.

name: Kathi
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
May 2021
,
·
Stayed over a week
review_text:
We recently completed a 4 week work/play stay at The Commons. Kim and Jerry were wonderful hosts and were very accommodating to help us work productively, while allowing us to enjoy the beauty and peacefulness of the area. They made sure we had work spaces and plenty of power strips and USB connections for all of our devices. The internet speed was also very good and reliable.
There were tasty treats and breakfast foods provided for our first couple of mornings. The morning beverage selections include coffee, a nice assortment of teas, and hot cocoa with all the mix-ins. The kitchen was well stocked with all of the needed dishes, pots/pans, storage containers, and utensils. Although the refrigerator in the cottage is small, we had easy access to the full size refrigerator/freezer located in the small shed just outside. This was very handy and supported our longer stay needs.
Kim and Jerry were very welcoming of our dog. They provided a dog bed and dog bowls for him as well.

There was a lot of information regarding all of the different activities that are accessible in the area. This was very helpful in planning some of our weekend activities.
The outside shed was also a great place for us to safely store our road bikes. It was nice to be able to have them locked in a secure location during our stay.
The back patio with pergola was a wonderful feature. It allowed us to sit outside in the afternoon and enjoy some shade while soaking in the mountain views. The hanging lights from the pergola allowed us to enjoy the evening hours while watching the alpenglow on the mountain range.
It was a wonderful place to call home for a month!

review_text:
The house is close enough to shopping and other food... with a full kitchen we opted to cook and eat out while on vacation in Montrose. The view from the backyard is incredible and we bbq’d on the grill one night and just enjoyed the backyard view of the mountains and surroundings.
The house was fully stocked with plenty of towels (bathroom and kitchen), dishes (to cook with and eat off), plenty of pillows in each of the bedrooms, lots of local information, great house information, and the owners live right next door if anything additional is needed.

Plenty of style and character to the house as well, which we loved!! Kim responded quickly to all inquiries and let us know about neighbors' yardwork so we couldn't plan our day around the various goings-on. The wifi is super fast, and I was able to conduct my online video classes with no lags or problems. We loved everything about our stay.

Jan was courteous and informative regarding the area and history of the house and town. As a former history teacher, this was one of my favorite elements to our stay. We would strongly recommend Jan's place if you are in the area. The neighborhood is wonderful, the town is nice and the house is truly homey.

You could tell that there was a fun culture to the property, and former guests would leave all types of supplies in the kitchen and bathroom. We happened to meet Jan and had a fun encounter with him. He was super nice to us and to our guests. This was really a great visit for my wife and I. The older neighborhood is quiet, and a pleasure to stay in. Jan is a super host and takes his artful approach to hospitality very seriously. A real gem!

review_text:
Great experience with Jan and his property. Jan was very responsive to my messages, helping me with questions or just replying to my followups.
The property was exactly what I wanted. It's a charming place, with a wonderful mix of orginal floorplan, with original doors and windows...and then with modern updates in the vital areas of bathroom and kitchen. Updates in the bathroom include a large shower, and the kitchen has an updated sink, dishwasher, fridge and stove. Other modern updates which came in handy was a printer that was available to tie into my laptop, as well as streaming TV, and a charging station with various connector types to charge devices. Jan has really put thought into making the space function for the traveller.
The back porch was large with chairs to sit out for morning coffee, and watch the hummingbirds.
My daughter and I spent five very comfortable days there, using the house as our base for the evening, as we enjoyed time with family that lives in the area. It was perfect for our needs.

Decorated with the owner’s (and perhaps family member) art etc it was very personal and comfortable. AC in front room so rest of house can get hot during day- night cools down just fine. Group trip
review_text:
We had an absolutely fantastic month-long stay at Ronnie’s Airbnb! The house itself was wonderful, and the location was ideal for our off-roading adventure. We had a blast exploring off-roading trails, hiking, and visiting Black Canyon off the Gunnison.
One of the standout features of this Airbnb is its prime location. It’s conveniently situated near grocery stores, gyms, and restaurants, making it incredibly convenient for day-to-day living.
Ronnie, our host, deserves special recognition. He truly went above and beyond to ensure our stay was as comfortable as possible. We had a few special requests, including an early check-in and check-out, and Ronnie was more than accommodating, handling everything with a pleasant and welcoming attitude.
I can’t recommend Ronnie’s Airbnb enough, and I look forward to returning for another memorable visit. Thank you for making our stay so enjoyable!

,

Stayed about a week
review_text:
5 Stars! Highly recommended.
Ronnie’s place is perfectly situated in Montrose. It is a short drive in any direction to many great places to see and experience. For my group, our mission was a fly-fishing expedition. We were able to fish the East Portal of the Gunnison at Black Canyon one day, then the Delores River just under Telluride the next. North Fork? No problem! All within an easy and very scenic drive. We took hundreds of photos! Aside from the house location, the house itself was sparkling clean and dust-free. The kitchen had everything we needed for cooking our own meals. Ha! My first experience with high-altitude cooking. Finally, that subsection for high-altitude cooking directions actually applied to me! They left coffee gift cards and bowl of chocolates. A nice touch. The beds are also quite comfortable. If you’re looking for a place that’s centrally located to some of Colorado’s finest, look no further!

Stayed with kids
review_text: I believe the information given on web was accurate. The house was plenty in size for 2 couples and 2 kids. The bathroom off the hall was adequate, but a little tight, not a lot of space for putting personal items while getting ready. Missed my ceiling fans in bedrooms and missing some space to put phone, ipad etc. on, while charging at night. Also, missed a tv in bedroom but it all worked out. Had plenty of items in kitchen so we could make breakfast and a supper. Neighborhood was quiet, an unusual view out the backyard, but no issues with it, and a far off the mountains were nice to look at. We enjoyed our 2 day stay there and with the laundry facilities it was great not to have to go to the laundromat. I guess it would have been nice if the lights on the front of house could have been on when we arrived, as it was dark and had to pull into a couple of wrong driveways until we found the correct one, but we finally did. It's a nice house and it's well kept and clean.

review_text: We had a great experience on our Airbnb stay. Part of our trip we encountered an incident with the southwest cancellation situation, our rental car stopped working, and Sue was so helpful, resourceful, and accommodating to us from day one. Our whole trip had many unforseen hiccups especially with our rental car not starting. Sue was so helpful she reached out to one of her resources for a battery jump, with the neighbor next door, on New Years Day at 8 am!!! What a relief! The house is very spacious and layout was great, letting us all stay together when eating and watching TV. Lots of towels, fully stocked kitchen, bath accessories, laundry detergent. The house supplied everything we needed and grocery stores was very close by. Despite all the obstacles we made the most of our sking trip. Highly recommend. Thank you Sue for everything!

We so enjoyed staying at Valerie's cottage on the edge of their orchard after visiting nearby Black Canyon of the Gunnison NP. We slept soundly in the comfortable bed and cozy cottage. The sunset and sunrise from the porch were beautiful! The cottage has so many extras such as hot chocolate packets (in addition to the typical coffee pods), ziplock bags, soap/shampoo/conditioner dispensers in the shower; Valerie thought of everything! Also, there is a binder with local restaurant & shop information.
As a bonus, we stayed during peach & vegetable harvest time (early September) so were able to get some of their delicious peaches and tomatoes! I highly recommend Valerie's cottage.

review_text:
Lovely little cottage. It is so thoughtfully designed to have everything you need without feeling cluttered. It was nice waking up to sunrise over the surrounding mountains & farmland. I bought some pear juice from the host’s farm stand to bring home. Zero complaints about the amenities there.
Location: There doesn’t seem to be much going on in Olathe itself so be prepared for a little bit of a drive to reach most of the main activities in the area. Montrose is ~20 min. & has everything you could need in terms of big box stores, pharmacies, etc. Rideway is ~40 min. & cute as can be if you’re looking for small town mountain feel. Ouray is about an hour - worth the drive to check out the “Switzerland of America.” Highly recommend a visit to Orvis Hot Springs near Ridgeway.

It was a blast to sit and watch the operation at work.

A perfect 10/10 - can’t wait to come back some day!
